noun.description: Any of several tropical American timbers: (originally) †= kingwood (obsolete); (later) the dark-coloured, light-veined timber of two West Indian trees, Cordia gerascanthus (family Boraginaceae) and Exostema caribaeum (family Rubiaceae) (also called Spanish elm); either of the two West Indian trees producing this wood.

origin: Mid 17th century. In some forms from the genitive of prince + wood. In β form from prince + wood. The trees and timbers are apparently so called on account of their stately appearance and high-quality wood.
